table.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;

tr.style: border: 1px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top

th.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; padding-top: 3px; padding-bottom: 3px

a.title: The logical name of the element

th.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; padding-top: 3px; padding-bottom: 3px

a.title: Minimum and Maximum # of times the element can appear in the instance

tr.td: B.1 Dispensation information (provided by the dispensing pharmacy)

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: #F7F7F7

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck10.png)

a.title: A unique number or code issued for the purpose of identifying a dispenser [ISO/TS 27527:2010]; this may be a licence or registration number which can be used to trace the dispenser and to check whether a medicinal product was dispensed by the right person according to the law of the dispensing country.

title.value: B.1 Dispensation information (provided by the dispensing pharmacy)

description.value: Dispensation information (provided by the dispensing pharmacy). Section B1 of the guidelines

copyright.value: Used by permission of HL7 Europe, all rights reserved Creative Commons License

short.value: B.1 Dispensation information (provided by the dispensing pharmacy)

definition.value: Dispensation information (provided by the dispensing pharmacy). Section B1 of the guidelines

A unique number or code issued for the purpose of identifying a dispenser [ISO/TS 27527:2010]; this may be a licence or registration number which can be used to trace the dispenser and to check whether a medicinal product was dispensed by the right person according to the law of the dispensing country.

short.value: B.1.2 Family name of the dispenser

definition.value: The family name/surname/last name of the dispenser. This enables the dispenser to be traced in the event of questions or emergencies.

short.value: B.1.3 Given name of the dispenser

definition.value: The given name/first name of the dispenser. This enables the dispenser to be traced in the event of questions or emergencies.
A unique number or code issued for the purpose of identifying a pharmacy [ISO/TS 27527:2010]; this may be a licence or registration number which can be used to trace the dispensing pharmacy.
Minimally, the country should be specified.
Details of direct contact could be an email address and/or phone/fax number of the dispensing pharmacy.
As described in A.1.2.
Information about the dispensed product as described in A.1.4. The cardinality of the data elements in the product description may differ between ePrescription and eDispensation.

The package size should be clear from the medicinal product data and the overall amount should be automatically calculable. The dispensed quantity may differ from the prescribed quantity. - Preferred system(s): UCUM, EDQM
The date and optionally the time of dispensation. - Preferred system(s): ISO 8601
Information whether and why the substitution took place

short.value: B.1 Dispensation information (provided by the dispensing pharmacy)

definition.value: Dispensation information (provided by the dispensing pharmacy). Section B1 of the guidelines

A unique number or code issued for the purpose of identifying a dispenser [ISO/TS 27527:2010]; this may be a licence or registration number which can be used to trace the dispenser and to check whether a medicinal product was dispensed by the right person according to the law of the dispensing country.

short.value: B.1.2 Family name of the dispenser

definition.value: The family name/surname/last name of the dispenser. This enables the dispenser to be traced in the event of questions or emergencies.

short.value: B.1.3 Given name of the dispenser

definition.value: The given name/first name of the dispenser. This enables the dispenser to be traced in the event of questions or emergencies.
A unique number or code issued for the purpose of identifying a pharmacy [ISO/TS 27527:2010]; this may be a licence or registration number which can be used to trace the dispensing pharmacy.
Minimally, the country should be specified.
Details of direct contact could be an email address and/or phone/fax number of the dispensing pharmacy.
As described in A.1.2.
Information about the dispensed product as described in A.1.4. The cardinality of the data elements in the product description may differ between ePrescription and eDispensation.

The package size should be clear from the medicinal product data and the overall amount should be automatically calculable. The dispensed quantity may differ from the prescribed quantity. - Preferred system(s): UCUM, EDQM
The date and optionally the time of dispensation. - Preferred system(s): ISO 8601
Information whether and why the substitution took place
